node.title: Bald Eagle Steals Shark From Fisherman's Line in Wild Video
node.alt: Chad Rissman was fishing with his uncle Darrin Vick off the Dunedin Causeway in Florida last week when he managed to reel in a shark, but before he could cut the shark loose, a bald eagle swooped down and claimed the shark.
node.description: "The way everything lined up, the sunset; I couldn't have asked for a better time," fisherman Chad Rissman said.
node.content:
["A Utah man fishing in Dunedin, Florida recently made an unforgettable catch.", "Chad Rissman was fishing with his uncle Darrin Vick off the Dunedin Causeway in Florida last week when he managed to reel in a shark, reported Southern Living. But before he could cut the shark loose, a bald eagle swooped down and claimed the shark as its own.", "The exciting moment was shared to TikTok by Rissman's wife Amanda, who wrote: \"When you snag a shark & the eagle takes the prize!\"", "In the 26-second clip, Rissman and Vick can be seen reeling the shark closer to the shoreline when, all of a sudden, a bald eagle flies in and pins the shark down with its talons.", "The family moves a bit closer to the eagle after it has landed, but the bird remains firmly planted on its prey for the remainder of the video.", "WFLA reported that the eagle stayed near the family for nearly 20 minutes as it ate the shark.", "According to the National Eagle Center, all eagles use their talons to kill their prey.", "\"Each eagle foot has four very sharp talons, three in the front-facing back and one larger talon [the hallux] in the back facing forward. The crushing strength of each talon [provided by powerful leg muscles] is estimated to be at least 400 pounds per square inch [psi] per talon,\" the center said.", "The center also explained that eagles can only carry about a third of their body weight, so they can't always fly away with their meal.", "\"If a bald eagle catches a fish that is too heavy to lift out of the water, the eagle may 'swim' a short distance to shore dragging the fish still gripped in their talons and using their wings in breaststroke fashion,\" the center said.", "The eagle in Amanda's video can be seen doing exactly that.", "Though Rissman certainly didn't expect for his catch to be stolen\u2014and by a bird, no less\u2014he still had a great time.", "\"The way everything lined up, the sunset; I couldn't have asked for a better time,\" Rissman told Fox 13 News. \"I used to identify as a Utah man, but now I'm definitely a Florida man.\"", "\"It's just like brushing the greatness of the country all into one picture and one experience,\" Vick added.", "", "
Chad Rissman was fishing with his uncle Darrin Vick off the Dunedin Causeway in Florida last week when he managed to reel in a shark, but before he could cut the shark loose, a bald eagle swooped down and claimed the shark.
"]
